basics.name: James Ward
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
I am an Engineer through and through - I solve practical problems. I get things done, ship amazing software, and create a superb user experience - all while hitting every specification and business requirement.  Unit tests, end to end testing, and test driven development are my go-to tools for crafting solid code in a multitude of languages

This isn't just a day job to me, it's a passion.

work.summary: Being the Chief Executive Officer of a company means you have your hands in everythng.
highlights: Build scalable data infrastructure to scale as needs require.
Design and implement user experience of the Hivemind platform.
Produce a full marketing website - from creating wireframes, to generating copy text, to writing the Javascript and HTML.
Approach leads to personally convert them to customers.
Generating actionable feedback for employees to encourage growth.

work.summary: Became a leader in the Wayfair Engineering Community, and grew to manage a diverse team of engineers to develop services for scalable, customizable, and personalized interactions with customers.
highlights: Managed engineering teams that enabled open communication with tens of millions of customers daily, connecting internally to generate over 15% of company revenue.
Used Storm and Dropwizard to ingest and act upon a large throughput of data, based upon user definable rule sets.
Extensively utilized multiple frontend frameworks to create a highly interactive user experiences.

work.summary: Refactored large portions of legacy PHP codebases to implement new features.
highlights: Wrote unit tests to verify changes would not break legacy code.
Created tooling and workflows for NOC automation.
Maintained basic Denial of Service mitigation and performed database/systems administration.

work.summary: Designed and implemented new features, bug fixes, and reduced the memory footprint of the flagship product.
highlights: Optimized the web stack and configuration installed on application nodes, drastically reducing server costs.
Worked alongside a team of talented programmers, using subversion and an in-house ticketing system.
Integrated the CMS with several third-party SOAP and REST APIs.
